tr.td: ECG that shows inferior ischaemic changes.
Accident and emergency or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
NHS other Hospital Provider - Ward for general Patients or the younger physically disabled or A and E department
Description of reaction: Rash. No swelling.

td.p: 60 year old man complaining of chest pain lasting around 2 hours.
Coronary angiogram demonstrated diseased RCA, drug eluting stent successfully placed.
Appropriate secondary prevention medications prescribed for follow up with Cardiac Rehabilitation team.

tr.td: Patient arrived in Accident and Emergency complaining of chest pain and admitted to ward for further tests.
The coronary angiogram indicates a diseased RCA.
Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent

Discharge type: Usual place of residence unless listed below, for example, a private dwelling whether owner occupied or owned by Local Authority, housing association or other landlord. This includes wardened accommodation but not residential accommodation where health care is provided. It also includes Patients with no fixed abode.

Leeds Community Healthcare NHS Trust
Identifier: RY6
Hospital needs to arrange for transportation to the patient's home.

td.p: Patient seen by Cardiac Rehab and information given regarding the diagnosis and possible life style changes when he is discharged.
Richard is concerned about whether he can drive and asks about this as he is a self employed electrician.
Dr Paul Rastall advised him that he should not to drive for at least a week, but reassured him that he should be able to drive once recovered and said he will arrange for a community follow-up.

Full Blood Count

tr.td: Dose directions description: One 2.5mg tablet once a day.
Dose directions description: Take one 75mg tablet once a day.
Dose directions description: Take one 75mg tablet daily for one year then stop.
Dose directions description: Take one 40mg tablet once a day.
Dose directions description: Take one 5mg tablet daily.
Comment/recommendation: Uptitrate according to BP and HR

display.value: Patient and carer concerns, expectations and wishes

tr.th: Person and carer concerns, expectations and wishes
tr.td: The carer is concerned about the possibility of the patient suffering from a heart attack, bearing a similarity to the illness of the mother of the patient. The patient is worried about the impact of their illness on their ability to work and drive.

Relationship: Next of kin
Contact details: Tel. 0712345678 Email. mrssmith@mymail.com

tr.td: Patient to attend community follow up after discharge.

tr.td: Patient agreed to avoid driving for one week on discharge.

Percutaneous coronary intervention
Anatomical site: Right coronary artery structure
Comment: Patient successfully underwent angioplasty procedure to place a drug eluting stent.

Electrocardiographic monitoring
Comment: ECGs showed inferior ischaemic changes and diseased RCA.
